result.execSummary:
The defendant Elliott K. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay Restitution of $680 among all files within 60 days prior to discharge of probation.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination of both to equal full time.
Have a Mental Health Assessment and comply with any treatment recommendations if there are any.

No direct or indirect contact with  Carlotta Shaw or Lashawn Lewis. 
Before having contact with Lisa Adams, Defendant is to have prior written permission of agent first. Agent may permit or refuse that at their discretion. If there is contact, then no violent or abusive contact with Lisa Adams.

Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent if there are any.
Submit DNA Sample for one charge.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elliott K. Adams in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Elliott K. Adams in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-368, 15CF-370 and 15CF-369.

2:54 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea hearing at this time.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, parties are not requesting a PSI.
Atty McFarland states this will be a joint recommendation.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Atty Knaapen states plea agreement.

15CF-368 Defendant will plead to Count 3 and Count 4. Count 1 and Count 2 dismissed and read in
15CF-369 Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 dismissed and read in
15CF-370 Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 dismissed and read in
State provides Restitution Summary and Victim Impact Statement to the Court.

Atty McFarland concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-368: Count 3: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-368: Count 4: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-369: Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-370: Count 2: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-368: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-368: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-368: Count 3: Found Guilty
15CF-368: Count 4: Found Guilty
15CF-369: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-369: Count 2: Found Guilty
15CF-370: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-370: Count 2: Found Guilty

Court advises Defendant as to felony charges regarding voting and deportation.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court, 131 days jail  credit. Jail is not being requested.

Court believes the joint recommendation is appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-368: 
Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 3 Years
No additional jail is ordered
If revocation issue arises, there are 131 days jail credit as of today's date
Conditions:
Have a Mental Health Assessment and comply with any treatment recommendations if there are any
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination of both to equal full time
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent if there are any
Submit DNA Sample for one charge
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay costs
Pay Restitution of $680 among all files within 60 days prior to discharge of probation
No direct or indirect contact with  Carlotta Shaw or Lashawn Lewis. Before having contact with Lisa Adams, Defendant is to have prior written permission of agent first. Agent may permit or refuse that at their discretion. If there is contact, then no violent or abusive contact with Lisa Adams. 

Count 4:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to Count 3
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stsated in Count 3
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

15CF-369:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to 15CF-368
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-368
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

15CF-370:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 3 Years, concurrent to 15CF-368 and 15CF-369
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-368 and 15CF-369
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Court has reviewed the victim impact statement.
